layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: My energy levels, clarity, and function are directly affected by what I eat and drink ...

answers.4: mostly — diet has a noticeable impact on how I function
answers.5: directly — food is fuel and the quality shows immediately
answers.2: possibly — but I don't notice consistent patterns
answers.3: somewhat — some foods clearly affect me, others don't seem to
answers.1: not really — I feel the same regardless of what I eat

questions.text: The connection between sleep patterns and next-day performance is ...

answers.4: strong — sleep quality clearly predicts next-day performance
answers.5: direct — sleep debt compounds and shows in everything
answers.2: unclear — sometimes sleep helps, sometimes it doesn't matter
answers.3: partial — poor sleep sometimes affects me
answers.1: weak — I function fine on any amount of sleep

questions.text: Sustained poor nutrition leading to predictable health outcomes is ...
questions.principle: Nutritional choices compound into health outcomes

answers.4: generally true — poor nutrition usually catches up
answers.5: certain — you reap what you sow with nutrition
answers.3: likely — there's probably a connection, with many exceptions
answers.1: overstated — plenty of people eat poorly and stay healthy

questions.text: My physical environment affects how I feel and function ...

answers.4: mostly — cleanliness, organization, and air quality clearly matter
answers.5: directly — environment shapes energy, focus, and wellbeing
answers.2: possibly — but I adapt to any environment
answers.3: somewhat — extreme environments affect me, normal ones don't
answers.1: not really — I can work anywhere

questions.text: I can connect periods of feeling good or bad physically to what I was consuming ...
questions.principle: Physical state correlates with physical inputs

answers.4: usually — I can trace most physical states to inputs
answers.5: clearly — my body reflects what I put in and how I rest
answers.3: sometimes — some periods connect to consumption, others don't
answers.1: not at all — physical states seem random

remediation.advice: Track what you eat and how you feel for two weeks. The correlation between fuel quality and performance quality will become undeniable. Your body is a machine that runs on what you give it.

scripture.text: So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
